intro: Fumana viscida var. laevis, commonly known as the smooth fumana, is a flowering plant native to certain regions of South America. It belongs to the Malvaceae family, which includes hibiscus and cotton. The plant is characterized by its hairy stems and showy, pale pink to white flowers that bloom in summer. Its leaves are typically heart-shaped and have a smooth texture, giving it the "viscida" and "laevis" descriptors. It thrives in moist, well-drained soils and is often found in woodland or shrubland habitats.
